cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue WNW across the northern Caribbean, pass near the Turks & Caicos and southeastern Bahamas late Thursday, then curve northwest-north toward South Florida/Florida Keys late Sunday–Monday

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, northern Dominican Republic & Haiti, Turks & Caicos, southeastern & central Bahamas, eventually Florida peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) have a 31 % cumulative chance, peaking late Sunday–Monday; 50 kt winds chance 12 %, 64 kt 6 %.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Irma tracks up the Florida peninsula then exits near GA/SC, on-shore flow could drive 3–5 ft surge along the Georgia coast early next week.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could spread into coastal Georgia Sunday night–Monday with locally 4 inches or more possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells, high surf and dangerous rip currents beginning this weekend will affect port approaches and pilot boarding areas.
